name: Yirong Zhou, Ph.D. candidate
introduction: Yirong Zhou was born in Wuhan, Hubei, China in 1994. He received B.S. in Statistics from the University of Science and Technology of China, in 2017 and M.S. in Statistics from George Washington University, in 2019. He is a current Ph.D. Student in Civil & Environmental Engineering at the University of Utah under the supervision of Prof. Xiaoyue Cathy Liu. His research focuses on data-driven transportation system modeling.

name: Zhiyan Yi, Ph.D. candidate
introduction: Zhiyan received his M.S degree in Transportation Science & Engineering department in Beihang University in 2018. He is currently a Ph.D. student in the third year. His research interests include spatio-temporal analysis, data-driven strategies, and electrical vehicle charging demand analysis.

name: N. Nima Haghighi, Ph.D. (alumnus)
introduction: Nima graduated from Sharif University of Technology and received his Ph.D degree in 2019. He is experienced in mining spatiotemporal and crowdsourced traffic data (e.g. HERE data, social media data, and Bluetooth data).

name: S. Kiavash Fayyaz (alumnus)
introduction: Kiavash received his Ph.D. degree in 2017. Previously, he hold a B.S. degree in University of Tehran, and M.S. degree in Institut Mines-Telecom Business School majoring International Management.

name: Zhuo Chen, Research Assistant Professor (alumnus)
introduction: Zhuo was a Ph.D. student in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering at the University of Utah from 2013 to 2017. She graduated with a Master degree in Civil Engineering from Georgia Institute of Technology. She worked as research assistant professor since 2017.

name: Zhuang Dai (visiting Ph.D)
introduction: Zhuang Dai was a visiting Ph.D student from Beihang University from 2018 to 2019.

name: Qian Zuo, M.S. (alumnus)
introduction: Qian Zuo received her master degree in Computer Science in the University of Utah in 2019.

name: Ruoyang Shen M.S. (alumnus)
introduction: Ruoyang was a master student graduated in 2020 from the Computer Science department in the U.
